title: Update command shouldn't suggest older "stable" version if already on latest candidate

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

Update command shouldn't suggest older "stable" version if already on latest candidate

```
[INFO] Instructions to update this project from '3.0.0.CR1' to '2.16.5.Final':
[INFO]
[INFO] Recommended Quarkus platform BOM updates:
[INFO] Update: io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-bom:pom:3.0.0.CR1 -> 2.16.5.Final
```

### Expected behavior

No update needed

### Actual behavior

Update suggestion printed

### How to Reproduce?

- Download app from code.quarkus.io, pick CR stream, not the stable/recommended one
   - e.g. https://code.quarkus.io/?S=io.quarkus.platform%3A3.0
- run `mvn quarkus:update`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
